Posts.Content: I have had 3 FEC now and the mouth symptoms are the ones I hate the most. I don't have ulcers it just tastes horrible and feels dry and spongy. Is it worse with the docetaxal? I also can't stop eating today. I just had a cheese and coleslaw sandwich followed by , in less than an hour a sausage sandwich!!!!!!!!! I don't normally eat bread!!!
Posts.Title: Docetaxal and dry throat/mouth

Posts.Content: You can get Manuka Honey from health food shops. It is produced in New Zealand by bees that only pollinate a certain tree for two weeks of the year. It has antibacterial qualities (hospitals have honey impregnated dressings) and has to be 10+ or over strength to be any good. The higher the strength the more expensive. I have 24+ at the moment but last time had 20+ which was I think about £20 for a small jar. I took a teaspoon a day sometimes two and had no mouth soreness at all with second FEC. Now I put a teaspoon of it in a lemsip and it soothes my throat. I also bought some toothpaste with Manuka Honey in it to protect my gums. I couldn't stand the taste of corsydyl toothpaste. I still use the difflam mouthwash the oncologist gave me Hope this helps
Posts.Title: Docetaxal and dry throat/mouth

Posts.Content: i have spent 3 days in bed now, I phoned my GP who was lovely and prescribed me Tramadol and zopiclone to help me sleep.I slept from 8-4 last night then took another Tramadol. The pain is still apparent but I can feel I am coming to the end (bloody hope I am anyway). Only two more to go. In my life Ihave never felt as bad as this.Even my implants are stabbing and hurting me.
Posts.Title: Aches and pains with Docetaxel

Posts.Content: I had first tax on weds. I have been bed bound all weekend. Took some cocodamol and proceeded to be violently sick. That's a first for me. My head neck jaw hips knees stomach thighs every where is aching. Took some tramadol that my other half had. I am going to ask GP for some. Still feel sick. The weekend has passed me by. This is horrible. Feeling sorry for my self. I was warned though!.
Posts.Title: Aches and pains with Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Dear Ali woke up this morning feeling like the fog had lifted and thought great I am through the side effects. I have had to call the Doctor again after getting Tramadol yesterday crying with the throbbing pain in my back. I have had two doses of oromorph which has done the trick finally!  I cannot believe how  bad this has been.
Posts.Title: Aches and pains with Docetaxel

Posts.Content: I went in to the local CO OP one day and the chap at the till  said 'new hair cut then?' 'No!....... actually I had to have chemotherapy.......for breast cancer' 'was you a smoker then?' !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I couldn't think of a response !
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: My mum when I was bald 'ohhhhhh its lovely it reminds me of when you were my little baby'.............thanks mum!
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: Hi Mo You need to ask for a home visit. If you are having chemo and feeling that bad. A GP surgery is  bad place to be sitting when you are at a risk of infection. I really feel for you......I just finished My docetaxol two weeks ago and each time was different and the nausea and actual vomiting was aweful and I had been told that was worse with the FEC!. I am thinking of you. Avril
Posts.Title: docetaxel has floored me

Posts.Content: Deaqr Ruby I had microcalcifications in my left breast that turned out to be cancer, It was very early stage though.I had a vacuum biopsy and the radioghraper told me she thought she had removed most of them. They looked like grains of salt on the ultra sound. The waiting and wondering is terrible once you know you can focus on treatment. Avril
Posts.Title: mammo found clusters of microcalcifications. Very scared!

Posts.Content: Dear Daphne I had my cancer diagnosed back in August in the right side. It was the lymph node that was enlarged and they say I would never have felt the tumours in my breast becasue they were too deep. Then because the core biopsy indicated that it was lobular cancer I was sent for an MRI scan. I was told I had micrcalcifications in the left breast that weren't cancerous. My consultant even got another consultant to come and see me to try to persuade me not to have a bilateral mastectomy which I was insisting on because in my mind these calcifications are an indication of cancer. I really had to stick to my guns because they did not want as far as i could tell to do my op ( I had reconstruction with implants at the same time).  When I got the histology/pathology reports back I actually had two types of cancer in both breasts! I had to go back for node clearance on the left because I had had a mastectomy and they could not test the lymph nodes. If I had not gone with my instinct could I have been facing all this again when the cancer in the right breast became apparent or could the chemo this time have sorted it. I will never know. What I do know is I had it taken away before it could get any where else.  I am recovering well from my operations. I have full range of movement in my arms (ops were in October) I have just had my third chemo. My implants are settling I think MIstyMoley on this site has them and says it takes months for them to really settle. It is actually quite nice having smaller perter boobs...I was a 38ff now 38c . The sensation is different  and I will think about nipple tattoos or reconstruction later.  When I really stop to think about it I cannot believe what has happened to me over the last year. I never understood what women went through with it.  I am 48 seperated and have been with my other half for two years. I feel sorry for him having to go through this with me it will be a real test of our relationship! You will make the right decision for you at the time. I just wanted to get it out of my body. Avril
Posts.Title: Second primary cancer just diagnosed

Posts.Content: Dear Shaz I had my surgery in October. I have just had my fourth chemo. Have you had chemo?. I have had axillary clearance both sides and only one node was involved. Avril x
Posts.Title: Info please HELP

Posts.Content: Dear Shaz I am seeing the radiotherapist on the 10th March to discuss why they now say I have to have rads on my right side. I had a bilateral mastectomy and immediate reconstruction with silicone implants and they used a dermal sling as I had enough skin to make a 'natural droop'. My right side has always felt a bit harder and tighter and a a bit uncomfortable at times I do not think I could stand it if things went wrong because of radiotherapy. She is going to have to really convince me that I need it before I agree to have it. When are you due to have your rads? Avril
Posts.Title: Info please HELP

Posts.Content: Hi Comper22 I never really got diarrohea with TAX just really bad constipation and that horrible bloated feeling. My worst days were day 5 - 6 and I would only be comfy in bed. I hated the way my mouth and nose were. This time I have been asleep days 3-5. I have also had really bad smelly bowels (sorry to be so blunt) that have made me feel really horrible. I spent half an hour laying on the bathroom floor drenched in sweat on Easter Sunday with a crampy stomach! I know what you mean about the 90yr old aches and pains. I think this chemo affects us all slightly differently. Can't wait to feel a bit normal. x
Posts.Title: Tax !

Posts.Content: Congratulations to your daughter. She must be so proud of her self too. I couldn't run to the end of the road!
Posts.Title: VERY PROUD OF MY DAUGHTER

Posts.Content: Well done Bev cannot wait to be in your place. I still have 3 to go......its good to hear about people that have done it. Happy hugs to you x I know I don't know you but feel I do x
Posts.Title: yahooo

Posts.Content: I cannot stop baking. I never used too. I am trying profiteroles today. Second attempt... read reciipe wrongly and put too much flour in. They looked like large seagull droppings and were as hard as stone!!! x
Posts.Title: yahooo

Posts.Content: Hi Ali i feel I want to die at the moment I have never been so frightened of anything in my life I would rather go through the double mastectomy again than have this last chemo.I am usually such a strong person but I am ready to run! Your last session was a day after my last one......Have you got your taste buds back yet? My constipation usually resolves itself..but I have had some scary times too with that  (like giving birth!!!!!) Thank you for the hug. Avril
Posts.Title: Is The Third Tax The Worst?

Posts.Content: Dear Yvonne I just want you to know that I a thinking of you and have every thing crossed hoping all goes well. It is not right that you have all this to deal with. We women are strong though and when we take a day at a time we can do it. Your husband needed a release. Your daughter will be alright she may not think so now but she will. Your son has to sort himself out you can't do it for him. Love Avril xx
Posts.Title: I just feel so angry with my self & everyone else

Posts.Content: Hi Sammi I had double mastectomy immediate reconstruction and axillary clearance, Then had to go back for clearance the other side because there was cancer there too. Have since been told those nodes were clear. Should be really glad they were clear but have been hospitalised with wound infection since and still on antibiotics (3 weeks) and its painful. Especially in evenings, its a stabbing pain. I took more tramadol than I should have last night and my sleeping tablet and I was still restless (the tramadol isnt even mine). I had implant reconstruction and I feel like I am wearing a contraption on my chest that is tight under the arms and I want to get it off.I do my exercises religiously.The discomfort pain from this is always worse in evenings too. I try to remain positive and little comments from my other half saying that I could be more positive make me cross because this thing is on my mind all the time and I cannot see an end. The only time I am not thinking about it is when I am properly asleep and even then dreams are related to it.I feel like I have had enough already and there is still so much to go through. They want to start chemo before Christmas I need a flu jab, my coil removed a portacath inserted and was also told i need radiotherapy too when I have permanent implants and they initially said I wouldn't need it. Don't be sorry about whining I know exactly how you feel. Four months down the line I don't think you should still be in intense pain. May be speak to BC Nurse she may have an idea. You hear people say about nerves knitting together...it maybe that. I like you have had enough...... my whole life has been disrupted and I have no control. Whine if you want to and I will join you! Avril xx
Posts.Title: when does it end?

Posts.Content: Dear Mrs D Please don't let me frighten you. I am just feeling sorry for myself and if you are pre warned you can be pre armed. It is all do-able and once I have that last treatment at least I know I have not got to do it again. It is not something to look forward to but I.........we......can do it as others have! Avril xx
Posts.Title: Is The Third Tax The Worst?

Posts.Content: Thanks for responding, I had bloods done to check my hormones over a year ago because of the side effects of Tamoxifen and I was told I was I was post menopausal. I have not had a period for about twenty years because I had a Mirena coil in situ. My chemo finished May 2015 which puts you in menopause, doesn’t it? The oncologist gave me Anastrazole to try but the joint pains were so bad, this is why I try to compromise by taking tamoxifen every other day not every day. I have been fine but as I say the last two weeks it’s been awful. I don’t have an appointmen5 with the oncologist until next year but I see my breast consultant tomorrow will they be interested?
Posts.Title: Why extreme flushes now?

Posts.Content: I take Tamoxifen every other day because I could not stand the hot flushes and drynes down below. I have been fine for the past year or so doing this. I got occasional night sweats and flushes but I could cope. The past two weeks however th3 flushing is unbearable it’s so embarrassing my face neck chest and arms go bright red. My skin on my face is so dry due to the heat. What can I do. I’m considering stoppin* it to see if it makes a difference. I’m 51 my diagnosis was 2014. I had bilateral mastectomy and chemo.  I’m miserable and worried that it may be a sign that it has returned. Hi
Posts.Title: Why extreme flushes now?

Posts.Content: Dear mistymoley I just wanted to say thank you for your reply and comment about the pain/tightness I have from the implants. That does make sense that it is the muscles having to stretch to accommodate, I don't know why I didn't think that myself. It has made me feel better. The day I posted that I was feeling, excuse my language, "bloody" miserable! You made me feel better. Avril x
Posts.Title: when does it end?

Posts.Content: Hi every one! I am due my third and final Tax a week today. I am still suffering from sore eyes, blocked bloody nose a mouth that feels like it has a film around it and no taste buds, not to mention the muscle aches and fatigue.I had a good day on Monday and then yesterday I couldn't get out of bed. Normally by this stage I am getting taste buds back and feeling better.  The thought of doing this again to myself is making me sink so low I can't stop crying I want to tell the Oncologist I don't want the final one. Is the final one going to be worse than the first two? Avril
Posts.Title: Is The Third Tax The Worst?

Posts.Content: Dear Crystal kitty I totally get what you mean. My mum was round and whilst she paid the window cleaner because I was post mastectomy she told him!!! .......I told her to get back to her house quickly because the dustbin men were due and she could tell them too!!!!!!!  I walk my dog locally and the other day it was so nice to talk with someone who didn't know and just talk about what plans we were making for Christmas.I felt normal then for 1/2 an hour. I want to enjoy Christmas but this is on my mind 24/7 unless I take a sleeping tablet. I can't see it getting better any time soon either. I am only 4 days post first fec.  Avril x
Posts.Title: Fed up of cancer being the focus ...

Posts.Content: I have a Port. It was fitted in November. At first it was uncomfortable and it felt that it was going to pop through the skin. I also had a heavy dragging sensation in the neck chest area. I took regular paracetamol for about three days. Now I do not really know that it is there! Having blood taken and the chemo administered with it is easy!
Posts.Title: port painful?

Posts.Content: Hi Lindsey I am just 6 days post my second chemo. I had surgery in October. Bilateral mastectomy bilateral removal lymph nodes and immediate reconstruction with implants. I am 48. First advice which I took from this site is to take one day at a time. Looking too far ahead is too overwhelming and when I do this I can spiral in to despair. I want my old life back ...it is not fair etc! Chemo is hard but I think others get through it ...so can I. The first day the tiredness hits like a lead balloon and I have to sleep. Eating is difficult that day because of nausea. The next day my mouth starts to feel a little different but nothing too bad. Oh and Lindsey drink at least a litre of water while you are actually having the chemo to flush it out, you will know you have done it right when your urine returns to its normal colour. I will also give this advice ask for a PICC Line or Portacath do not let them mess your veins up first which happens to a lot of people. This will save so much trauma and distress. I have found this time that keeping frozen pineapple chunks to suck really helped with the horrible disgusting fuzzy chemo mouth you have around days 3-9 (for me any way) My head was shaved on Boxing day after handfuls coming away on Christmas day. I really thought I would be cool with this.......how wrong was I!. I had a total melt down I couldn't reconcile myself to who the person was in the mirror I cried for two days.  I now experiment with scarves and little beanie hats and i have a wig for when i want to go out. My first chemo was the 11th of Dec and I was out on new years Eve and saw the new year in!  This site is a godsend Avril xx
Posts.Title: Just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: Dear Monika I had surgery in October, node clearence both sides. Why have you been told to get a compression sleeve? I a flying in a couple of weeks and was wondering. Avril
Posts.Title: Flight stockings

Posts.Content: Dear Monika I had surgery in October, node clearence both sides. Why have you been told to get a compression sleeve? I a flying in a couple of weeks and was wondering. Avril
Posts.Title: Flight stockings

Posts.Content: Hi Lindsey I am just 6 days post my second chemo. I had surgery in October. Bilateral mastectomy bilateral removal lymph nodes and immediate reconstruction with implants. I am 48. First advice which I took from this site is to take one day at a time. Looking too far ahead is too overwhelming and when I do this I can spiral in to despair. I want my old life back ...it is not fair etc! Chemo is hard but I think others get through it ...so can I. The first day the tiredness hits like a lead balloon and I have to sleep. Eating is difficult that day because of nausea. The next day my mouth starts to feel a little different but nothing too bad. Oh and Lindsey drink at least a litre of water while you are actually having the chemo to flush it out, you will know you have done it right when your urine returns to its normal colour. I will also give this advice ask for a PICC Line or Portacath do not let them mess your veins up first which happens to a lot of people. This will save so much trauma and distress. I have found this time that keeping frozen pineapple chunks to suck really helped with the horrible disgusting fuzzy chemo mouth you have around days 3-9 (for me any way) My head was shaved on Boxing day after handfuls coming away on Christmas day. I really thought I would be cool with this.......how wrong was I!. I had a total melt down I couldn't reconcile myself to who the person was in the mirror I cried for two days.  I now experiment with scarves and little beanie hats and i have a wig for when i want to go out. My first chemo was the 11th of Dec and I was out on new years Eve and saw the new year in!  This site is a godsend Avril xx
Posts.Title: Just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: Dear Sandy You have had a lot to deal with in a very short time. i was diagnosed in August and did not get my surgery until Oct 1st. Then had second surgery to remove lymph nodes on left as there was cancer in that breast after negative biopsy and different scan results. I think I coped well  with the surgery I had immediate reconstruction with implants. I can be really positive outwardly but some times it hits me like a tonne of bricks and the tears come from nowhere and I can't stop them. I wonder will I ever be the same again.I have had my first chemo and my second is on tuesday. My friend shaved my head on boxing day because my  hair was falling out in handfuls. I kept it together that day because we went to my brothers.Travelling back in the car I started crying and I couldn't get myself out of that mind set for the rest of the day and the next day. My partner had to go away for a day and night and I was so glad to see him go because as soon as he was out of the house I bawled my eyes out loudly and let all my feelings out and began to wonder how do I get through this? it's too much, it is going to take so long my whole life has changed through finding one lump....I still do not know how I will get through, i have had thoughts  along the line of it wouldnt be so bad to let go.....but they did not last long. I know that i will get the crying days again followed by days when I feel able to cope. Sandy what ever we feel is allowed and is being felt by someone else in the same situation. I still cannot believe that this is my life. Big hug to you. x
Posts.Title: How should i be feeling??????

Posts.Content: Hi Rhonda I have been on Tamoxifen since last May. I take it first thing in the morning with a cod liver oil capsule ( cos My friend said it should help with joint stiffness). I also invested in a Lady magnet from boots £28 that I wear against my lower abdomen in my knickers day and night and I dont get many flushes during the day at all and the ones at night vary from maybe none that I noticed to perhaps 3 that drench me.The magnet may be worth a try for you. Avril
Posts.Title: Too Many Hot Flushes

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa I had chemo Dec 2015 following double mastectomy and silicone implants. If I had known how it was going to affect me I wouldn't have had it. I had one lymph node affected. I think you need to discuss with your Oncologist and ask him to give you statistics about the benefit of it. There is a predict tool they use. This may help you in your decision.  Avril
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn Definatlely mention your mole. Go to your GP if BC team not interested. Mine was on my thigh , l noticed it was more raised. I was lucky it was less than 1mm thick they took it off first appointment at dermatology clinic. My GP wasn't sure it was when he referred me.....I'm so glad he did. I as so shocked when they told me........thought I would be immune from other cancers because I had already had one ! Avril
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa I had chemo Dec 2015 following double mastectomy and silicone implants. If I had known how it was going to affect me I wouldn't have had it. I had one lymph node affected. I think you need to discuss with your Oncologist and ask him to give you statistics about the benefit of it. There is a predict tool they use. This may help you in your decision.  Avril
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa I don't know if it was the chemo that affected my implants ( I was borderline needing radiotherapy and declined it) but I have already had one replaced because of encapsulation and I am waiting on a date for the second for the same reason. I finished my chemo May 2015.  In September I found out a mole I've had all my life had changed and was a malignant melanoma. I'm convinced the Chemo changed my cells or was in some way responsible. I'm all clear though after a wider local excision. Can't wait to get the implant sorted so I can get some nipples! I was 50 this year and have just this month started  Anastrazole because I stopped the Tamoxifen in June as the side effects were horrible. I will do the same with Anastrazole if I can't bear side effects too. Life has to be bearable. Avril
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa I don't know if it was the chemo that affected my implants ( I was borderline needing radiotherapy and declined it) but I have already had one replaced because of encapsulation and I am waiting on a date for the second for the same reason. I finished my chemo May 2015.  In September I found out a mole I've had all my life had changed and was a malignant melanoma. I'm convinced the Chemo changed my cells or was in some way responsible. I'm all clear though after a wider local excision. Can't wait to get the implant sorted so I can get some nipples! I was 50 this year and have just this month started  Anastrazole because I stopped the Tamoxifen in June as the side effects were horrible. I will do the same with Anastrazole if I can't bear side effects too. Life has to be bearable. Avril
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn Definatlely mention your mole. Go to your GP if BC team not interested. Mine was on my thigh , l noticed it was more raised. I was lucky it was less than 1mm thick they took it off first appointment at dermatology clinic. My GP wasn't sure it was when he referred me.....I'm so glad he did. I as so shocked when they told me........thought I would be immune from other cancers because I had already had one ! Avril
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Jeanette loved your comment about the hairs on chin. I was having electrolysis before I was diagnosed. My chin is so smooth now i am on 3rd Fec  I pray that the chemo has killed those chin follicles off!!!! x
Posts.Title: Hair Care before and after Chemo

Posts.Content: I had my op 2 weeks ago and although I have'nt had my formal results yet (that comes on thursday) the consultant and BC Nurse have said I will need Chemo. I have had total axillary clearance on the right side and bilateral mastectomy and reconstruction with implants. During my 72 hrs in hospital I had 4 cannulas as they didn't last and were very painful. I am going to request a PICC line as I have only one arm they can use and I think the chemo will ruin my veins! and that freaks me out!
Posts.Title: picc lines

Posts.Content: I finished my treatment in April. I had both breasts removed and implants put in. I can't have mammograms as I have no breast tissue and scans don;t show things up until they are a certain size. I know this because I knew I had lobular cancer in my right breast and an MRI and CT scan prior to operation did not show up the cancer in my left breast. They found that after I had insisted on having both breasts removed. I have been told all I can do is feel for lumps and tell them about pains and symptons that are persistant. As some one else said on this thread, we just have to learn to trust our bodies again.
Posts.Title: How do you know if you have mets

Posts.Content: I took all the precautions with the dark nail varnish during and after chemo which I finished in April and I thought my nails were going to be alright. However, I have lost all my toenails and seven fingernails. I have glued false ones in place as I find it too uncomfortable to go with the 'nubs' i have been left with. This on top of no hair is too much! but I will cope. Avril
Posts.Title: lost a nail

Posts.Content: Dear Mighty Mo After all those months of feeling horrible then starting to feel so much better in myself, I even have a start back to work date and then my nails started falling off! The false ones help me cope. I dont care if it means the natural ones may take longer to grow. My hair is growing back and I go bald in the house but wear little hats out side. I am going to Rome with my boyfriend in two weeks and I am going to suffer the discomfort of the wig because I want to feel feminine. Cancer can go and take a running jump It no longer has me in its grip! xxxxxx
Posts.Title: lost a nail

Posts.Content: Thank you Dreamthief Mike and Susie for your replies. This docetaxol is horrible isn't it. Two more to go. I wonder if anyone actually says I have had enough now no more chemo thank you!  I feel like that. Every one says carry on you can do it you are a strong woman............I don't have any choice!!!!!! When I think about the woman I was this time last year........where has she gone!  You can probably tell I am having a bad day!
Posts.Title: Horrible Taste in Mouth

Posts.Content: Dear Ali  I think yesterday and it was day 14 for me was the first day I actually felt like a fog had lifted and I felt better. I actually stayed up and watched DCI Banks. I have been going to bed by 7/8 (if I am not in it already!) I think my other half is beginning to think I am putting it some days because how can you feel like getting up for a walk on a sunday then want to stay in bed again on Monday. Wow Ali you have one more left! when is that because I will cheer for you on that date. I hate the thought that on weds I will be sitting in that chair having that stuff pumped in to me again and once its in there is no going back. I swear the best bit of the day on this tax is the night when I don't have to speak to anyone and can be left alone to be negative if I want to. We are not aloud to be negative in front of friends and family (you'll know what I mean) I am so fed up with the way my mouth feels and the thought that it stays for the duration of the tax is soul destroying. I have discovered Lemon sorbet that kind of tastes nice! Are you having a can't get out of bed day? I have to get up and pop in to work today to get a form signed. If any one says oh you are so strong brave lady I really want to say 'oh £$%!!! off!' that would shock 'em!  I won't say stay strong! just come on Ali one day at a time, when you have had that last one just imagine the feeling apart from the usual crappy ones that is! Thinking of you. Right 1 2 3 I must get out of bed and put make up and wig on........they would be shocked at work if I went in with out those! LOL xxx
Posts.Title: Horrible Taste in Mouth

Posts.Content: When I had FEC my mouth used to get horrible then recover well over a week before the next treatment. I have had doxetaxol on the 18th my next treatment is a week today and my mouth still tastes aweful. Is this the norm. Nothing tastes the same. My mouth is bitter. Avril
Posts.Title: Horrible Taste in Mouth

Posts.Content: Dear Jenny hope you enjoy your meal out tonight. You will have to  let us know if you could taste what you chose to eat! Avril x
Posts.Title: Horrible Taste in Mouth

Posts.Content: Dear Jane I smoked and gave up years ago before I was diagnosed. I had met a new man and he didn't like smoking so I never let him see me do it. I'd given up about a year before my diagnosis and I was glad because I always felt a little ashamed about it, hiding it from people etc. I have had five anaesthetics since October 2014 so another reason I was glad I had managed to stop. .....................but when I move on from this world the first thing I'm going to do is find a bar with a little table outside and sit and have a large glass of wine and a menthol cigarette and sit and people watch!    Thing is, it will probably make me feel sick! Don't beat yourself up about it.....x Avril
Posts.Title: massive panic! please don't hate me.

Posts.Content: That is what's good about this forum. It makes you realize that basically whilst we are all different we all have the same fears and worries. X
Posts.Title: massive panic! please don't hate me.

Posts.Content: Hi Dendy only just seen your post. You are only  two weeks post operation. I am assuming your drain has gone now and you are doing your stretching exercises that the hospital gave you. It takes a while but if you do them each day you will soon have your arm and hand straight up above your head. Lymphoedema is something we have to be aware of if we have had lymh node removal but it doesn't mean we are all going to get it. I am always checking my arms my wrists my fingers for signs of swelling. I also have what seems like a collection of fluid underneath my right side scar towards the back that I keep an eye on. Sometimes I imagine one of my arms is bigger but it is not. If the day comes and I think yes this is more swollen I will be straight on the phone to the BCN (even though I have had nothing to do with them since operation in October) insisting on a consultation as the sooner it is seen to the better.  Dendy we have already had a hard time and must now learn to live with all this and not spend every waking minute worrying about all the things that could happen. As time goes by it does get easier not to dwell so much,but I completely understand your fears. I f you want to ask me anything please do and I f I cannot help There is always somebody on this site which is invaluable who can shed some light with their experience and knowledge. Please try not to worry. Avril x
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi Kate I had 15 nodes removed on the right and 13 on the left. I also had bilateral mastectomies and immediate reconstruction with implants in October last year. I did the exercises from the leaflet the hospital gave me. I had a bit of cording and the BCN just said to stretch it out which I did. I now have full movement and I do stretching exercises daily. My arms appeared to have dents at one point but that has disappeared. My armpits feel numb but better than they were initially. I don't sweat so do not really need to wear deoderent that is a bonus! I worry about lympoedema as I have both sides to worry about but I will have to live with that. If you have to have lots of nodes removed I only had one affected you will be able to cope.
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi Ro looking through these messages today and came across yours. I too got my results yesterday following my bilateral mastectomy and reconstruction with implants at the same time. On the right side 1out of 15 nodes was affected and there were two types of cancer found grades  2 and 3. I had to really fight weeks ago for them to take my left breast as there were changes that showed up on MRI but they insisted they were nothing to worry about. My thought was if there is something not right now it will be cancer in the future.After loads of debate they agreed to what I wanted. Yesterday the consutant told me I was right and they had found two ares of cancer. I too have to go back to have lymh nodes removed as they cannot test because there is no breast tissue. I am gutted at the thought of more surgery I am just beginning to move around a little more normally and the scars are healing. I am dreading more surgery and still waiting for chemotherapy which terrifies me more than anything.  It is just take each day as it comes. People say you are so brave...I am not I just have to deal with what ever happens.It was reassuring that there was someone else going through the same.
Posts.Title: 2nd op for lymph node removal after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca, I was diagnosed August 12th I will never forget that day as even post surgery and first chemo it still goes down as the worst in my life. I really didn't think I had cancer when I went along to the clinic that day and was totally unprepared. What I will say and it sounds like a cliche but take one day at a time. Some days i am so low and tears come from no where and others I feel I can take on any thing. You will get through your surgery and you can deal with what ever else comes along a day at a time. I have found this site so helpful so much useful information you can ask anything you wwnt and someone will respond. Good luck for tomorrow. I don't know you but I will be thinking of you Avril x
Posts.Title: The unknown

Posts.Content: I have had my Portacath since November. It is clearly visible under the skin and you can see clearly 3 little points on it too. At first I thought it felt like it was going to pop through the skin. Sometimes I can feel like an aching kind of pain. It will eventually settle down and you will feel comfortable with it and begin to forget it is even there. I would think that as long as you have no signs of infection like redness heat or swelling it is probably ok. Chemo makes every thing feel weird even days after having it. If you are really worried the chemo unit nurses would look at it for you which would stop you worrying which I know is a horrible feeling. Avril
Posts.Title: Portacath Pain

Posts.Content: Dear Jo Ask for a portacath to be inserted. It never needs changing you get to bathe shower as normal and it's hardly visible under clothes. More importantly it will mean that no more of your veins will be messed up. It's traumatic having a pic line inserted and I don't think veins repair themselves. I had one because I had bilateral axillary clearance but I still had to ask for one. I only knew about them because another lady told me about hers in a breast clinic waiting room one day. Avril
Posts.Title: PICC line aborted

Posts.Content: Hi Lizard You have every right to express every emotion you are feeling. I think you probably are experiencing  every emotion ever invented and some.So glad you do not have secondary cancer.X I WOULD BE '"##@@@@ FURIOUS!!!!!!!! and you need to let them know the effects of information being delivered in this way. IT'S HORRIBLE.  Avril
Posts.Title: Told I was misdiagnosed and it's NOT bone secondaries, it's Avascular...
